title: Woman branded a 'pumpkin' by her young son slims down from size 22 to size 12
text:

An obese mum branded a 'pumpkin' by her son says his frank comments inspired her to drop five dress sizes .

Colette Cunnington, 43, from Romiley, Greater Manchester, dropped from a dress size 22 to a 12, after John, six, spotted her wearing an orange t-shirt.

He yelled 'mummy you could be a pumpkin' - and those words changed her life.

She has spent her whole adult life trying to lose weight but nothing worked until she signed up for The 1:1 Diet by Cambridge Weight Plan, following John's comments.

Colette now says she couldn't feel any less like a 'pumpkin' and can't wait to show off her svelte figure this Halloween .

(Image: Caters News Agency)

(Image: Caters News Agency)

Colette said: "It was just after Halloween, we were looking at photos my friend had put on Facebook when I heard little voice over my shoulder.

"John looked at the photo and just said 'woo mummy you look like a big pumpkin!'

"John is autistic and children can't lie at the best of times but his comment did hurt my feelings.

"That day I actually thought I looked good, I had put makeup on, I felt good with myself but when I saw that photo I thought I looked such a state, such a mess.

"That was what motivated me to start The 1:1 Diet by Cambridge Weight Plan - before that I had tried everything to lose weight, but I wasn't losing anything. I was a dress size 22 and with two young children, I couldn't run after them.

(Image: Caters News Agency)

"When your confidence is so low, you just think, 'what's the point, why bother? But the turning point was John's comments and I haven't looked back since."

Colette - who has now dropped from 13st 9lb to 10st 4lb - says she had tried loads of things in the past in order to lose weight, calorie cutting, hypnosis and joining weightloss groups but none of them worked.

But when she tried The 1:1 Diet, she was so happy with the results that she decided to work with them as a consultant.

She vividly remembers the day she realised she was a size 12, when she went to try on a new coat.

She added: "I couldn't believe it when I made it to size 12, I remember going to try a coat on and I was thinking 'no way it will fit.'

"I did the button up and the zip and I just screamed 'I'm a size 12,' it was such a huge moment.

(Image: Caters News Agency)

"I was so excited as the last time I was a size 12 I was in junior school- now being able to go into a shop and actually buy something is amazing, I just can't get over it.

"I am much happier now, I can actually look after my children, I feel healthier, everybody says I look better, I feel brighter.

"My self-esteem is absolutely through the roof now, which I didn't feel it before.

"I'm trying things out I never did before, I got a haircut, I had my nails done, those girly things before I was thinking 'why bother making myself look nice?'

"My journey since that pumpkin comment makes me feel like I've gone from being a pumpkin to Cinderella."

BEFORE DIET Breakfast: a whole tin of tuna, cucumber and mayonnaise and a large glass of orange juice Lunch: a cheese sandwich, crisps, chocolate biscuits and a luxury yogurt dessert. Dinner: chicken curry, naan bread, rice, poppadoms and profiteroles for dessert Snacks: a full tube of Pringles, chocolate, full pack of custard creams.

AFTER DIET Breakfast: Weetabix with skimmed milk or a One to One Diet by Cambridge Weight Plan product such as Maple and Pecan porridge Lunch:Salad with tuna or chicken Dinner:Salmon, vegetables and a chocolate chewy bar. Drink:at least 2.25ltrs of water a day
description: Colette Cunnington reveals exactly how she got rid of the weight after being ribbed by her six-year-old in Romiley, Manchester
